article.text: Druze spiritual leader Sheikh Naim Hassan condemned the murder of Sunni cleric Ahmad Abdel Wahed on Sunday, the National News Agency reported. “[I call] on everyone to calm down and be [wise],” the NNA quoted Hassan as saying. Hassan also called for punishing the perpetrators “no matter who they are,” and urged the Lebanese army to not allow strife in Lebanon. Army troops shot dead Sheikh Abdel Wahed on Sunday when his convoy failed to stop at a checkpoint in North Lebanon, the scene of deadly clashes linked to the uprising in Syria, a security official said according to AFP. The sheikh’s bodyguard, Mohammad Hussein Merheb, was also killed.-NOW Lebanon
